content: I'm currently working on updating statement, I will add images to it, so people can understand it better. The swap rule is already working on uploaded version.

Looks good.  Possibly a bit similar to UTTT but the extra branching factor should make a wider variety of strategies possible..

Needs a better message for an invalid output (eg any string or extra spaces before/between numbers) - currently the game just ends with nothing in the summary.

The hexagons showing the players last moves don't appear to have the text placed correctly, the right hand edge of the hexagon goes through the side of wider numbers (0/8)
cool, but you need to make the rules more clear and fix the swap rule. (upvoting)

great idea,
a game "easy to play, hard to master", I upvote!

please make the rules more clear a and details. the links to the detail rule are ok but you should details a little more. 
for the game turn input it is the number of row of the grid (because it is said 'each row' on the next line)
do you intend to make it possible to have 3 players?
Actually, the game is correct but the rules need more explanation. Still upvoting !

The swap rule is not correct (at least according to the usual game rules). Player 2 must only select the same hexagon (effectively swapping piece colors). In the current implementation, player 2 will always be able to play a winning move because he can choose a different hexagon..

Thanks for the feedback, I'll be sure to update statement.
I don't have any intention atm to make it have 3 players.
